titleStmt.title: Virginius J. Tobias to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2305

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
To
His Excellency
the Governor of the State of Kentucky
Frankfort, Ky.
Dear sir,

I beg to make application for a renewal of my appointment as Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, resident in Charleston South Carolina, and to supply the vacancy occasioned by recent death of Mr Samuel J. Hull former Commissioner in this City -- and would state that I am a loyal citizen of the United States and hold Commissions from many of the other States. I am (and have been for the past 12 years), a practising member of the Charleston Bar, and the appointment being one much needed in my profession, if renewed, its duties will be discharged with every care and ability.

Your attention will oblige
Very Respectfully
Your Obt Servt
Virginius J. Tobias

Comr Deeds
South Carolina
Virginius J. Tobias
comd 13th Nov 1865
